sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A remarkable letter of Mary Howgill to Oliver Cromwell, called Protector a copy whereof was delivered by her self to his own hands some moneths ago, with whom she had face to face a large discourse thereupon : unto which is annexed a paper of hers to the inhabitants of the town of Dover. Howgill, Mary. Cromwell, Oliver, 1599-1658.
[2], 6 p.
Printed and are to be sold at the Black Spread-Eagle at the west-end of Pauls, London : 1657.
Written by Mary Howgill. Cf. BM. Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
=======

Howgill, Mary. Cromwell, Oliver, 1599-1658.
[2], 6 p.
Printed and are to be sold at the Black Spread-Eagle at the west-end of Pauls, London : 1657.
Written by Mary Howgill. Cf. BM. Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
the Black Spread-Eagle at the west-end of Pauls
